wikipedia_page.main: Kenneth William Nicholas (3 February 1938 – 24 March 2007) was an English sportsman, best known for his football career. After playing both football and rugby for his country at schoolboy level, Nicholas became a professional footballer. He, playing in England as a full back, then featured for Arsenal, Watford, Guildford City, Hastings United and Tonbridge as well as teams in Portugal.

response: Catleigh died on 5 April 1996 in Watford, Hertfordshire, aged 63. Among those present at his funeral were former team-mates Holton, Uphill and Ken Nicholas, and Graham Taylor, who at the time was Watford's general manager.
